titleStmt.title: Office of the Adjutant General of Ohio

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Office of the Adjutant General of Ohio

body.p: The office of the chief military officer and advisor to the Governor of the State of Ohio. Resides in the Executive Branch of the State of Ohio. Civil War-era Adjutant Generals: Henry B. Carrington (1857-1861); Catharinus P. Buckingham (1861-1862); Charles W. Hill (1862-1864); and Benjamin R. Cowen (1864-1868).

ab.bibl: The biographical annals of Ohio 1906-1907-1907: A handbook of the Government and Institutions of the State of Ohio, A. P. Sandles and E. W. Doty (eds.), State of Ohio, p. 590.
